DOC.brief_summary: This study evaluate program provide birth control low income minority woman home visit community health nurse . The goal program reduce unwanted pregnancy .
DOC.brief_title: Providing Birth Control Through Home Health Visits
DOC.detailed_description: Unintended pregnancy associate significant public health problem , include inadequate prenatal care , low birth weight infant , infant mortality , maternal morbidity mortality . Children born result unplanned pregnancy great risk poor outcome poor mental health developmental disability . This research project determine whether provide contraception home reduce incidence unintended pregnancy low income minority woman . The project also determine whether delay pelvic exam encourages discourage utilization clinic-based preventive service screen sexually transmit disease ( STDs ) cervical cancer . Participants randomize either experimental group comparison group . Each participant receive family plan counsel home visit community health nurse . Participants experimental group offer three-month supply oral contraceptive depo-provera shot ; form contraceptive deliver home visit . Each participant complete survey initial visit 1-year follow-up . The study last approximately three year .
DOC.criteria: Women child bear age Not pregnant Interested delaying pregnancy use oral contraceptive depoprovera shot Had sex last month plan sex next month Have use contraception every sexual encounter within 3 month prior study entry
